p: In summary, C. articulatus rhizome EO presents muskatone, cyclocolorenone, α-pinene, pogostol, α-copaene and caryophyllene oxide as the main chemical constituents. In addition, this oil causes cell cycle arrest in the G 2/M phase and cell death in HepG2 cells and inhibits tumor development in a xenograft model. The results obtained indicate the anti-liver-cancer potential of C. articulatus rhizome EO. Future studies should be directed to this EO to clarify the mechanism of action and toxicological aspects to develop C. articulatus as a new herbal medicine.
